title: Tenebrous
data:
**Tenebrous, the Demonic Shadow** is a [spirit](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\) "Spirits (dNetHack)") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Ritual, seal and taboo](#Ritual.2C_seal_and_taboo)

- [2 Mark](#Mark)

- [3 Benefits](#Benefits)

- [4 As a monster](#As_a_monster)

  - [4.1 Generation](#Generation)
  - [4.2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Ritual, seal and taboo

Tenebrous's seal must be drawn in an unlit square, and is always generated on the square where [Orcus](/index.php?title=Orcus_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Orcus (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") is killed.

To remain bound to Tenebrous, the character must not permanently light squares, e.g. via [wand of light](/wiki/Wand_of_light "Wand of light") or [scroll of light](/wiki/Scroll_of_light "Scroll of light").

## Mark

A character that has Tenebrous bound possesses an unnaturally dark shadow that pools close to them - this can be seen from a distance, and can be hidden by staying out of illuminated squares.

## Benefits

While bound, Tenebrous confers [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") and grants [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in [maces](/wiki/Mace "Mace").

Tenebrous's active powers are as follows:

- **Damning Darkness**: Damage all monsters that are not [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"), [demonic](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") or drain resistant near the character, with the exact radius dependent on the character's level. Monsters in lit [squares](/wiki/Square "Square") take 5 dice of damage, while monsters in unlit squares take 1d5 dice of damage, and squares within the radius are made dark as with a cursed scroll of light.
- **Echos of the Last Word**: Targets an adjacent monster - any monster that is [unique](/wiki/Unique "Unique"), drain resistant, demonic, or untargetable for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") is [level teleported](/wiki/Level_teleport "Level teleport"), and the target will otherwise be removed from the game.
  - [Dread seraphs](/wiki/Dread_seraph "Dread seraph") and [black flowers](/wiki/Black_flower "Black flower") are uniquely immune in that the power will fail *and* unbind Tenebrous if used on them, and [intoners](/wiki/Intoner "Intoner") will [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") into black flowers instead of being removed if the power is used on them.
- **Touch of the Void**: Drain levels from an adjacent monster on a successful [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") roll.

Tenebrous's passive powers are as follows:

- **Vital Sense**: The character senses all living monsters on the level.

In notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack, **Tenebrous**, v, also appears as a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that can be summoned by an Illithanachronounbinder. It is a [vortex](/wiki/Vortex "Vortex") that is capable of [following](/wiki/Follow "Follow") the character to other levels if it is adjacent. Tenebrous possesses [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"), [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance"), [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance"), and [stoning resistance](/wiki/Stoning_resistance "Stoning resistance").

Tenebrous has two [life draining](/wiki/Life_drain "Life drain") touch attacks, and a reach attack that combines positive and negative energy. The damage rolled for the combination attack is dealt in two "stages": the first stage deals the outcome of the roll as [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock") damage, then again as [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire") damage, and [stuns](/wiki/Stun "Stun") the target for 3 turns; the second stage deals the outcome of the roll as [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold") damage, then drains a level regardless of damage - the elemental damage in both "stages" also affects inventory. The first set of effects can be wholly blocked with [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance"), while the second can be blocked completely with drain resistance.

Like many summoned spirits, Tenebrous cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame").

### Generation

Tenebrous is first generated when summoned from his seal by an Illithanachronounbinder. It is always created hostile, and is not a valid form for normal [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Tenebrous is [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") the uncursed +3 **Touch of the Void**, an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") pair of [gauntlets of dexterity](/wiki/Gauntlets_of_dexterity "Gauntlets of dexterity") that confer drain resistance while worn and can be safely enchanted to +7 - unarmed attacks performed while wearing The Touch of the Void have +1 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and deal double damage against targets without drain resistance, and will additionally drain a level from the non-resistant target.

Tenebrous [does not leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death.

### Strategy

If Tenebrous is killed after being summoned, it can be encountered again in the [Void](/index.php?title=Void\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Void (page does not exist)"), a branch accessed by opening the high [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") of [Ilsensine the Fallen](/wiki/Ilsensine_the_Fallen "Ilsensine the Fallen") as an Illithanachronounbinder using the [invoke](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") effect of [The Elder Cerebral Fluid](/wiki/The_Elder_Cerebral_Fluid "The Elder Cerebral Fluid"). Tenebrous is generated along with many other spirits of the near void on the second floor of the branch, and is generated with the "whispers" template, which makes it [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving").
